title: The challenge of surtitling at the Avignon Festival

Call boy and ex-heroin addict, Tom B: 'In West Berlin, everyone mixed and chose their scene'
subhead: 'Being 20 in West Berlin' (4/6). Tom B. came to West Berlin as a young gay man in the mid-1980s, became an escort and fell into drug addiction, just as AIDS began to strike. Now in his sixties, the sex worker and social worker has come a long way.

title: Zelensky urges allies to seek 'regime change' in Russia after latest deadly drone attack on Kyiv
Trump envoy to inspect Gaza aid as pressure mounts on Israel
Glyphosate: French court clears Bayer-Monsanto of responsibility in birth defects case
subhead: In a judgment handed down Thursday, the court ruled that the severe birth defects of Théo Grataloup, now 18, could not be attributed to in utero exposure to glyphosate.

title: Trump orders tariffs on dozens of countries to go into effect next week
subhead: Among those who managed to strike deals with Washington were Vietnam, Japan, Indonesia, the Philippines, South Korea and the European Union. Britain also reached a pact with the US, although it was not originally targeted by higher 'reciprocal' tariffs. Trump did not finalize a deal with Canada, but he reached an agreement with Mexico.

title: The friends who cement their platonic relationships through marriage
subhead: Difficult to quantify because they are often unofficial, unions between friends have been growing. They offer a way to honor friendship at a time when people are challenging the traditional, heteronormative couple and its conventions.

title: Chef Thomas Besnault's sylvan inspiration
subhead: 'Chefs' Gardens' (2/5). At his restaurant Ardent, the young chef creates inventive cuisine using ingredients foraged from the woods of Esvres, in central France.
byline: By Léo Pajon (Esvres (central France), special correspondent)

title: Gabriel Hagai, a mystic and political rabbi
'White people shoot at us': Southern Brazil's Indigenous communities fight for ancestral land
subhead: In Mato Grosso do Sul, a southern state bordering Paraguay, Indigenous people who tried to reclaim the lands from which they had been dispossessed face violence from large landowners. The left-wing government largely remains powerless in the face of this tragedy.
byline: By Bruno Meyerfeld (Kurusu Amba, Dourados [Brazil], special correspondent)

title: In the DRC, Chinese and American companies race for lithium
subhead: In the southeast of the Democratic Republic of Congo, the city of Manono sits atop the world's largest reserves of this mineral essential to the energy transition. A Chinese group signed the first contract there in 2022, followed this year by a California-based company.
byline: By Guillaume Jan (Manono (Democratic Republic of Congo), special correspondent)

title: In Brazil, the free and instant mobile payment system Pix challenges US dominance
subhead: Launched by the Central Bank of Brazil, this system is now used more than credit cards and cash. Its popularity is so great that WhatsApp had to abandon a payment system it wanted to launch locally.
